Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Let's start with the first line. Behold the sweetfish river, running through my beloved home of old. Where was Grandfather's old home again?"
Steam (ST): "Let's start with the first line. Behold the sweetfish river running through my beloved hometown. Where was Grandfather's hometown again?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Let's start with the first line. My beloved hometown, the sweetfish river running through it. Where was Grandfather's hometown again?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「まず１行目。懐かしき、故郷を貫く鮎の川、か。祖父さまの故郷ってどこだっけ？」
Russian (RU): "Давайте начнём с первой строчки. Через край родной мой, отрада моя, изобильная айю река катит воды свои. Ещё раз, где находился родной край дедушки?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos começar com a primeira linha. O rio dos ayus passa pela minha amada cidade passada. Onde foi mesmo que o vovô nasceu?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先第一行。“令人懷念的，貫穿故鄉的鮎之川”麼。爺爺的故鄉是哪兒來著？」

Indonesian (IDN): "Mari kita mulai dari baris pertama. Lihatlah sungai sweetfish yang mengalir melalui kampung halamanku tercinta. Di mana kampung halaman Kakek, ya?"

Turkish (TR): "İlk satırla başlayalım. Tatlı balık nehrine bakın, sevgili memleketimin üzerinden geçen. Büyükbabamın eski evi neredeydi?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "I heard that, before the war, the Ushiromiya family had a mansion near Odawara. So, that said, you'd want to know about a sweetfish river that flows through Odawara, right?"
Steam (ST): "I heard that before the war, the Ushiromiya family had a mansion near Odawara. Which makes you wanna know which sweetfish river flows through Odawara, right?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I heard that, before the war, the Ushiromiya family had a mansion near Odawara. So, that said, anyone would want to know about the sweetfish river that flows through Odawara, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「戦前の右代宮家は小田原の辺りに屋敷を構えてたって聞いたぜ。んで、となりゃ、小田原に流れてる鮎の泳ぐ川に関心が行くわけだろ？」
Russian (RU): "Я слышала, что до войны семья Уширомия владела поместьем рядом с Одавара. Получается, ты бы хотел узнать, не протекает ли сквозь Одавара река, в которой водится айю, не так ли?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu ouvi que, antes da guerra, a família Ushiromiya tinha uma mansão próxima de Odawara. Então, você quer saber sobre rios de ayus que passam por Odawara, certo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「聽說戰前的右代宮家在小田原一帶弄了套房嘞。你看，這樣一來，關注點就變成小田原有沒有游著鮎魚的河了對吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「听说战前的右代宫家在小田原一带弄了套房嘞。你看，这样一来，关注点就变成小田原有没有游着鲇鱼的河了对吧？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Aku dengar sebelum perang, keluarga Ushiromiya punya rumah besar di dekat Odawara. Jadi kau pasti ingin tahu sungai sweetfish mana yang mengalir di Odawara, kan?"
Italian (IT): "Ho sentito che prima della guerra, la famiglia Ushiromiya aveva una villa nei pressi di Odawara. E questo ti porta a chiedere se ad Odawara scorrano dei fiumi in cui nuotano ayu, vero?"
Turkish (TR): "Savaştan önce Ushiromiya ailesinin Odawara yakınlarında bir malikanesi olduğunu duymuştum. Bundan dolayı Odawara'dan geçen tatlı balık nehrinin hangisi olduğunu merak edersin, değil mi?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah, because that river's the starting point. And then it's got, you who seek the Golden Land, follow its path downstream in search of the key. What rivers are in Odawara? It's got to be one with sweetfish swimming in it."
Steam (ST): "Yeah, 'cause that river would be the starting place. Anyone searching for the Golden Land would head down that and search for the key. What's this river in Odawara? Does it have sweetfish swimming in it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Because that river would be the starting place. Anyone searching for the golden land would head down that and search for the key. What's the name of the river in Odawara? Does it have sweetfish swimming in it?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「まずはその川が起点になるからなぁ。んで、黄金郷を目指す者はそいつを下って鍵を探せとあるわけだ。小田原にある川って何だ？　鮎が泳ぐ川だぜ？」
Russian (RU): "Именно, так как река — отправная точка. И тогда, в поисках Золотой Земли, следует спуститься по её течению на поиски ключа. В Одавара есть какие‐либо реки? Среди них должна быть хоть одна, в которой водится айю."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, porque o rio é o ponto de partida. E então temos, aqueles que almejam pela Terra Dourada, sigam rio abaixo e procurem pela chave. Que rios existem em Odawara? Tem que ser um onde tenha ayus."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「畢竟首先就是以這條河為起點嘛。接下來就到這句“追尋黃金鄉之人啊，沿其而下尋找鑰匙吧”了。在小田原有什麼河啊？是有鮎魚在游的河哦？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「毕竟首先就是以这条河为起点嘛。接下来就到这句“追寻黄金乡之人啊，沿其而下寻找钥匙吧”了。在小田原有什么河啊？是有鲇鱼在游的河哦？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Iya, karena sungai itu akan menjadi titik awal. Siapa pun yang mencari Tanah Emas akan menyusurinya dan mencari kunci. Sungai apa yang ada di Odawara? Apakah ada sweetfish di dalamnya?"
Italian (IT): "Quel fiume è quasi sicuramente un punto di partenza. Da qui è logico che chi anela la Terra Dorata, cercherà la chiave percorrendo il suo corso verso la foce. Quali sono i fiumi di Odawara? Ci sono fiumi in cui nuotano ayu?"
Turkish (TR): "Evet, çünkü o nehir başlangıç noktası olmalı. Ve sonra, anahtarın arayışında, akıntı yönündeki patikayı takip edeceksiniz, Altın Diyar'ın peşinde olan sizler. Odawara'da hangi nehirler var? İçinde tatlı balıkların yüzdüğü bir nehir olmalı."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "For sweetfish in Odawara, it'd be the Hayakawa. It's famous for its mountain stream fishing."
Steam (ST): "If you're looking for sweetfish in Odawara, it'd have to be Hayakawa. It's famous for its mountain stream fishing."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "For sweetfish in Odawara, it'd be Hayakawa. It's famous for its mountain stream fishing."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Um rio com ayus, deve ser o Hayakawa. É famoso pelo fluxo de pesca na montanha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「要是說起小田原的鮎魚的話，那應該就是早川了吧。早川是以溪流垂釣而著名的哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「要是说起小田原的鲇鱼的话，那应该就是早川了吧。早川是以溪流垂钓而著名的哦。」

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon‐chan, who didn't have any afternoon chores for a while, was faithfully keeping us company.
Steam (ST): Shannon-chan was faithfully keeping us company, since she didn't have any afternoon chores for a while.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon-chan, since she didn't have any afternoon chores for a while, was faithfully keeping us company.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Shannon‐chan, que não teve nenhuma tarefa esta tarde, fielmente nos fez companhia.

Umineko Project (UP): I would have thought that, as a servant, accompanying us would force her to take care of us and tire her out, but it seemed that it wasn't so in her case.
Steam (ST): I would've thought that, since she's a servant, accompanying us would force her to take care of us and tire her out, but that didn't seem to be the case for her.

PC Japanese (JP): 使用人という立場上、俺たちに付き合った方がかえって気を遣って疲れちまうんじゃないかと思ったが、彼女の場合はそうでもないらしい。
Russian (RU): Я бы предположил, что она, будучи служанкой и сопровождая нас, вынуждена будет за нами ухаживать, из‐за чего она выбьется из сил, но, похоже, это было не так.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu pensei que, como uma serviçal, nos acompanhar iria forçá‐la a tomar conta de nós e a deixaria cansada, mas parece que não é o caso.

Italian (IT): Pensavo che, per via della sua posizione di domestica, tenerci compagnia l'avrebbe fatta impensierire e stancare di molto, ma questo non pareva essere il suo caso...
Turkish (TR): Bir hizmetkâr olarak bize eşlik etmesinin onu bizimle ilgilenmeye zorlayacağını ve yoracağını düşünürdüm, ama onun için durum pek öyle değilmiş gibi görünüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...To the contrary, it seemed she was having fun joining in on the conversation with people of a similar age.
Steam (ST): ...On the contrary, she seemed to enjoy joining in on a conversation with people close to her age.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …むしろ、歳の近い人間たちと一緒に会話に加われるのが楽しいようだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Pelo contrário, parece que ela está se divertindo muito conversando com pessoas da mesma idade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …倒不如說，看起來她因能和年紀相近的人一起聊天而感到很高興。

Turkish (TR): ...Aksine, kendi yaş grubundaki insanların sohbetine katılarak eğleniyor gibi görünüyordu.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu perguntei, ela disse que morava no trabalho.{n}Por isso, a única pessoa por perto é a Jessica.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Alright, so I get that the sweetfish‐filled river near Odawara is the Hayakawa. In that case, we have to go down it! Don't you find anything if you head down the Hayakawa?"
Steam (ST): "Okay, so I get that the sweetfish-filled river near Odawara is Hayakawa. In that case, we've gotta go down it! Do you find anything if you head down Hayakawa river?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Alright, so I get that the sweetfish-filled river near Odawara is Hayakawa. In that case, we have to go down it! Don't you find anything if you head down Hayakawa river?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「さて、小田原で鮎の川って言えば早川だってことはわかった。となりゃ下るしかねぇよな！　早川を下ると何があるんだろうなぁ？」
Russian (RU): "Ладно, я так понял, что река рядом с Одавара, в которой водится айю, это Хаякава. В таком случае мы должны спуститься вниз по течению! Есть ли там что‐нибудь ниже по течению Хаякавы?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certo, então já sabemos que o rio cheio de ayus perto de Odawara é o Hayakawa. Nesse caso, nós precisamos descer! Você não lembra de nada que possa se encontrar descendo o Hayakawa?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好了，這下知道小田原的鮎之川是早川了。那就該接著往下看了！順著早川而下有什麼啊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好了，这下知道小田原的鲇之川是早川了。那就该接着往下看了！顺着早川而下有什么啊？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Oke, jadi kita tahu bahwa sungai yang penuh sweetfish di dekat Odawara adalah Hayakawa. Kalau begitu, kita harus menelusurinya! Apakah kau akan menemukan sesuatu jika mengikuti Sungai Hayakawa?"
Italian (IT): "D'accordo, ho capito che l'Hayakawa è un fiume di Odawara con degli ayu. Allora dobbiamo seguire il suo corso! Si trova qualcosa scendendo lungo l'Hayakawa?"
Turkish (TR): "Pekala, Odawara yakınlarındaki tatlı balık dolu nehrin Hayakawa olduğunu anladım. Bu durumda, aşağı inmeliyiz! Hayakawa'dan aşağı doğru gidersen bir şey bulamaz mısın?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course, you'd reach the mouth of the river! And then the third line of the epitaph was "As you travel down it, you will see a village." By the way, since long ago, the mouths of rivers have generally been key points for transportation, and large cities tend to be built there. That'd be the next checkpoint."
Steam (ST): "Of course, you'd reach the mouth of the river! And the third line of the epitaph was "As you travel down it, you will see a village." By the way, since long ago, the mouths of rivers have been key points in transportation, and large cities tend to be built there. That'd be the next checkpoint."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Of course, you'd reach the mouth of the river! And then the third line of the epitaph was 'If you follow the river downstream, you will find a village.' By the way, since long ago, the mouths of rivers have been key points in transportation, and large cities tend to be built there. That would be the next checkpoint."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうさ、河口部に出る！　そして碑文の三行目には、川を下ればやがて里ありとあるな。ちなみにそういう河口部は大抵、大昔から輸送の要衝になってて大きな都市があるもんさ。　ここが次のチェックポイントだなぁ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうさ、河口部に出る！　そして碑文の三行目には、川を下ればやがて里ありとあるな。ちなみにそういう河口部は大抵、大昔から輸送の要衝になってて大きな都市があるもんさ。ここが次のチェックポイントだなぁ」
Russian (RU): "Ну конечно же, ты достигнешь устья реки! А в третьей строке эпитафии говорилось: 'По течению вниз спустившись, набредёшь ты на деревню'. Кстати, с давних пор устья рек были ключевыми местами перевозок, и там строились города. Оно должно быть следующим ориентиром."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É claro, você vai chegar à foz do rio! E a terceira linha do epitáfio diz "Quando você descer o rio, encontrará um vilarejo." A propósito, desde muito tempo, a foz dos rios tem servido geralmente de pontos chaves para transporte, e grandes cidades tendem a ser construídas por perto. Esse deve ser o próximo {i:checkpoint}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「說得對啊，那就是到入海口！然後碑文第三行是“沿川而下，終會發現‘{c:86EF9C:里}’”。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“日本文化相關”條目）}順便一提，一般來說這種入海口自古以來就都成了交通樞紐，普遍都坐落著大都市。這兒就是接下來要注意的要點了吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「说得对啊，那就是到入海口！然后碑文第三行是“沿川而下，终会发现‘{c:86EF9C:里}’”。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“日本文化相关”条目）}顺便一提，一般来说这种入海口自古以来就都成了交通枢纽，普遍都坐落着大都市。这儿就是接下来要注意的要点了吧。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Tentu saja, kau akan sampai ke muara sungai! Dan baris ketiga dari epitaf berbunyi "Saat kau menelusurinya, kau akan melihat sebuah desa." Ngomong-ngomong, sejak lama, muara sungai merupakan titik penting transportasi, dan kota besar cenderung dibangun di sana. Itulah titik pemeriksaan berikutnya."
Italian (IT): "Ma certo, arriverei alla foce del fiume! E poi, il terzo rigo dell'epigrafe dice che seguendo il suo percorso, si vedrà infine un villaggio. Tra l'altro, spesso nelle foci dei fiumi ci sono grandi città che in passato erano nodi cruciali per i trasporti. Sarà questa la nostra prossima meta."
Turkish (TR): "Tabii ki, nehrin ağzına ulaşırsın! Kitabenin üçüncü satırı ise şöyleydi: "Bir köy göreceksiniz, patikada ilerlerken." Bu arada, çok eskiden beri nehir ağızları genellikle ulaşım için kilit noktalar olmuştur ve büyük şehirler buralarda kurulur. Bu bir sonraki dönüm noktası olurdu."

PC Japanese (JP): 「第一の晩に、鍵の選びし六人を生贄に捧げよ、…か。いきなり物騒になるな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「第一の晩に、鍵の選びし六人を生贄に捧げよ、…か。いきなり物騒になるな」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No segundo crepúsculo, os remanescentes devem separar os dois que são próximos. Isso seria acabar com o romance deles? Ou literalmente parti‐los ao meio? Eu não sei, mas de qualquer forma, é repugnante."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "But there's something pretty interesting written at the end. The lines about how, after reaching the goal, four treasures will be given by the witch. One shall be all the gold. The problem is the next one. It says she'll resurrect all the dead people's souls, right? Doesn't it seem like this refers to everyone that died in the earlier lines?"
Steam (ST): "But at the end, there's something pretty interesting. After reaching the goal, the witch gives out four treasures. One shall be all the gold. The problem is the next one. It says the dead souls will be resurrected, right? Doesn't that sound like it means everyone who died in the earlier lines?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "But at the end, something pretty interesting is written. The lines about how, after reaching the goal, the four treasures will be given by the witch. One shall be all the gold. The problem is the next one. It says the resurrection of the souls of all the dead, right? Doesn't it seem like this refers to everyone that died in the earlier lines?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「しかしよ、最後のところには面白ぇことが書いてあるぜ？　ゴールした後、魔女からもらえる４つの宝の行だよ。一つは全ての黄金。問題は次だ。全ての死者の魂を蘇らせるとあるぜ？　みんな死んじまった、っていうのと掛けてるような気がしねぇか？」
Russian (RU): "Но есть кое‐что интересное в самом конце. В строчках о том, что после того, как достигнешь цели, ведьмой будут вручены четыре дара, первым из которых будет золото. Настораживает следующее. Здесь говорится, что она воскресит мёртвые души, так? Не относится ли это ко всем, кто погиб в предыдущих строчках?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mas tem algo bem interessante escrito no final. As linhas sobre como, após chegar ao objetivo, os quatro tesouros devem ser concedidos pela bruxa. Um deve ser todo o ouro. O problema é o próximo. Ele diz que ela deve reviver a alma de todos que morreram, certo? Isso não se referiria a todos que morreram nas linhas anteriores?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不過，最後那段可是寫了有趣的東西哦？到終點後，從魔女那可以拿到四樣寶物那段。一樣是全部的黃金。問題是第二樣。令所有死者靈魂復甦哦？不感覺和大家都死光了的那句相對應嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不过，最后那段可是写了有趣的东西哦？到终点后，从魔女那可以拿到四样宝物那段。一样是全部的黄金。问题是第二样。令所有死者灵魂复苏哦？不感觉和大家都死光了的那句相对应吗？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Tapi di bagian akhir, ada sesuatu yang cukup menarik. Setelah mencapai garis akhir, penyihir memberikan empat harta. Satu adalah seluruh emas. Masalahnya ada di yang berikutnya. Katanya jiwa-jiwa yang telah mati akan dibangkitkan kembali, kan? Bukankah itu terdengar seperti semua yang mati sebelumnya akan hidup kembali?"
Italian (IT): "Ma alla fine c'è scritto qualcosa di piuttosto interessante, vedete? Il rigo in cui, dopo aver raggiunto il traguardo, si riceveranno quattro tesori dalla strega.{n}Uno sarà tutto l'oro. Il problema è la parte successiva. Quella in cui parla della resurrezione di tutte le anime dei morti, no? Non vi sembra che si riferisca a tutti coloro che erano morti in precedenza?"
Turkish (TR): "Ama son kısımda yazılan oldukça ilginç bir şey var. Hedefe ulaştıktan sonra, cadı tarafından dört hazinenin nasıl verileceği ile ilgili satırlar. Biri tüm altın olacak. Sorun bir sonraki. Tüm ölü insanların ruhlarını dirilteceğini söylüyor, değil mi? Bu, önceki satırlarda ölen herkesi ifade ediyor gibi görünmüyor mu?"

Indonesian (IDN): "......Kalau kau menaruhnya begitu, maka bagian tentang menghidupkan cinta yang hilang mungkin merujuk pada pasangan yang terpisah di senja kedua."
Italian (IT): "...Se la metti così, il rigo seguente che parla persino della resurrezione dell'amore andato perduto... si può leggerlo come un riferimento ai due che erano vicini, che vennero poi divisi al secondo crepuscolo."
Turkish (TR): ".........Eğer böyle düşünürsen, kaybedilmiş aşkı diriltmekle ilgili olan bir sonraki kısım, ikinci alacakaranlıkta ayrılan çiftten bahsediyor olabilir."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. And the fourth one refers to the ninth twilight. The fourth treasure is putting the witch, revived on the ninth twilight, back to sleep again."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right. And the fourth one refers to the ninth twilight. The fourth treasure is putting the witch, revived at the ninth twilight, to sleep."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだね。そして４つ目も第九の晩に掛けてある。第九の晩に蘇った魔女を、４つ目の宝が再び眠りにつかせている。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだね。そして４つ目も第九の晩に掛けてある。第九の晩に蘇った魔女を、４つ目の宝が再び眠りにつかせている」
Russian (RU): "Точно. И четвёртая строчка имеет прямое отношение к девятым сумеркам. Четвёртый дар погрузит воскрешённую в девятых сумерках ведьму в сон."

Italian (IT): "Esatto. E il quarto tesoro si collega al nono crepuscolo. Il quarto è il riconferire alla strega il suo riposo, dopo essere risorta al nono crepuscolo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...If we interpret it favorably, it's hectic with people dying and being broken up, but it's all made well in the end. The awakened witch once again sleeps, and all that's left is plenty of gold."
Steam (ST): "If we put a happy spin on all this, it'll be hectic with people dying and breaking up all over the place, but it'll all be made right in the end. The awakened witch will sleep again, ...and everything'll be like it was at the start, except with a huge pile of gold."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If we interpret that favorably, it'll be hectic with people dying and breaking up, but it will all be made well in the end. The awakened witch will once again sleep, and all that will be left is plenty of left-over gold."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…好意的に解釈すりゃあ、死んだり別れさせたりと忙しいが、最後には全部チャラになるわけだな。目覚めた魔女も再び眠るし、手元にはたっぷりの黄金だけが残るって寸法だぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…好意的に解釈すりゃあ、死んだり別れさせたりと忙しいが、最後には全部チャラになるわけだな。目覚めた魔女も再び眠るし、手元にはたっぷりの黄金だけが残るって寸法だぜ」
Russian (RU): "...Если смотреть на всё с оптимизмом, то безумство разлучённых и умирающих людей сменится счастливым концом. Разбуженная ведьма вновь уснёт, и останется гора золота."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Se interpretarmos isso favoravelmente, é uma história frenética, com pessoas morrendo e sendo dilaceradas, mas tudo se resolve no fim. A bruxa que despertou mais uma vez volta a dormir, e tudo que sobra é o ouro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…往好的一面解釋的話，又要死又要分手的雖然很忙，但最後全部一筆勾銷。醒來的魔女也會再度睡去，變成啥事沒有只是身邊留著一大堆黃金嘞。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…往好的一面解释的话，又要死又要分手的虽然很忙，但最后全部一笔勾销。醒来的魔女也会再度睡去，变成啥事没有只是身边留着一大堆黄金嘞。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kalau kita melihat semuanya dengan sudut pandang positif, meskipun penuh dengan kematian dan perpisahan, semuanya akan diperbaiki pada akhirnya. Penyihir yang terbangun akan kembali tertidur, ...dan segalanya kembali seperti semula, hanya saja dengan tumpukan emas besar."
Italian (IT): "Se lo interpretiamo in maniera positiva, ci sarà un sacco di gente che morirà e che verrà divisa in due, ma alla fine tutto finirà per il meglio. Una volta risvegliata la strega tornerà di nuovo a riposare, e tutto ciò che resterà sarà un mucchio di oro nelle nostre mani."
Turkish (TR): "...Eğer olumlu şekilde yorumlarsak, insanların ölmesi ve ayrılmasıyla telaşlı bir süreç yaşanıyor ama sonunda her şey yoluna giriyor. Uyanan cadı bir kez daha uykuya yatar ve geriye kalan tek şey bol miktarda altın olur."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As páginas continham ilustrações coloridas de bruxas, desenhadas por ela, e transmitindo a fantástica imagem que a Maria tinha de todas as bruxas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這幾頁上都畫著各種各樣的魔女，充分表現出了真里亞對魔女的形象抱有多大幻想。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这几页上都画着各种各样的魔女，充分表现出了真里亚对魔女的形象抱有多大幻想。
Indonesian (IDN): Halaman-halaman itu penuh dengan gambar penyihir berwarna-warni... dan menggambarkan dengan baik citra fantasi penyihir dalam benak Maria.
Italian (IT): In quelle pagine erano state disegnate diverse immagini di streghe, e rendevano bene l'immaginario fantasioso che Maria aveva di esse.
Turkish (TR): O sayfalarda cadıların renkli çizimleri vardı, ve Maria'nın cadılarla ilgili fantastik imajını çok iyi yansıtıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): They were not depicted as the normal sinister crooked‐nosed hags flying around on brooms, but as dreamlike people with mysterious powers, who could do anything and wore beautiful dresses—just what you would expect from an imaginative young girl.
Steam (ST): It wasn't the normal sinister image of a crooked-nose hag flying around on a broom, but a dreamlike person with unnatural powers, who could do anything and wore a beautiful dress. It was just what you'd expect from an imaginative young girl.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was not the normal sinister image of a crooked-nose hag flying around on a broom, but a dreamlike person with unnatural powers that could do anything and wore a beautiful dress. It was just what you would expect from an imaginative young girl.
PC Japanese (JP): それは鉤鼻の老婆が箒で空を飛び…、というような定番の禍々しいものではなく、夢見がちな女の子なら、誰もが少女時代に思い描くような、美しいドレスを着飾って、不思議な力で何でもできる、夢のような存在として描かれている。
Russian (RU): То был не обычный зловещий образ крючконосой старухи, летающей на метле, но сказочной женщины, одетой в прекрасное платье и наделённой сверхъестественным могуществом, благодаря которому она могла делать всё что угодно. А что ещё ожидать от маленькой девочки с богатым воображением?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles não eram desenhos normais de bruxas assustadoras com narizes tortos voando em suas vassouras, mas pessoas saídas de sonhos com misteriosos poderes, que podiam fazer qualquer coisa e usavam lindos vestidos — tudo que você espera da uma jovem garota com muita imaginação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畫在上面的並不是騎著掃帚、飛在空中的鷹鈎鼻老太婆之類的…，那種典型的不吉形象，而是所有愛幻想的女孩都會在少女時期描繪的，穿著漂亮禮服，身懷奇妙的魔力，無所不能的夢幻存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 画在上面的并不是骑着扫帚、飞在空中的鹰钩鼻老太婆之类的…，那种典型的不吉形象，而是所有爱幻想的女孩都会在少女时期描绘的，穿着漂亮礼服，身怀奇妙的魔力，无所不能的梦幻存在。
Indonesian (IDN): Bukan gambaran seram penyihir berhidung bengkok yang terbang di atas sapu, tapi sosok seperti mimpi dengan kekuatan gaib, mengenakan gaun indah dan mampu melakukan apa saja. Itulah yang diharapkan dari seorang gadis kecil yang penuh imajinasi.
Italian (IT): Non le concepiva in modo sinistro, come delle classiche vecchie megere dal naso adunco che volano su delle scope... ma le aveva disegnate come qualunque ragazzina fantasiosa le avrebbe immaginate, ossia creature oniriche dai vestiti bellissimi, e capaci di fare qualsiasi cosa, grazie ai loro straordinari poteri.
Turkish (TR): Süpürgelerin üzerinde uçan, çarpık burunlu, uğursuz cadılar olarak değil, gizemli güçlere sahip, her şeyi yapabilen ve güzel elbiseler giyen rüya gibi insanlar olarak tasvir edilmişlerdi—tam da hayal gücü yüksek küçük bir kızdan bekleyebileceğiniz gibi.

Umineko Project (UP): Dancing through the sky, crossing a rainbow, dancing around all night with magical teacups and teapots that would never get empty no matter how much you poured out of them.
Steam (ST): Flitting through the sky, crossing a rainbow, dancing around all night with a teacup and a teapot that would never get empty no matter how much you poured out of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dancing in the sky, crossing a rainbow, dancing around all night with a teacup and a teapot that would never get empty no matter how much you poured out of it.
PC Japanese (JP): 空を踊るように駆け、虹を渡り、いくら注げども尽きない魔法の紅茶ポットやティーカップセットたちと踊り明かす。
Russian (RU): Танцующая в небе, пересекающая радугу, танцующая всю ночь с магической чашкой и чайником, которые никогда не пустеют, сколько бы ты не наполнял чашу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dançando pelo céu, atravessando o arco‐íris, dançando a noite toda com xícaras mágicas e bules de chá, que nunca ficam vazios não importa o quando você beba.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女像跳舞似的飛馳在天空中，跨過彩虹，和倒也倒不滿的魔法紅茶壺，還有成套的茶杯們徹夜舞蹈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女像跳舞似的飞驰在天空中，跨过彩虹，和倒也倒不满的魔法红茶壶，还有成套的茶杯们彻夜舞蹈。
Indonesian (IDN): Melayang di langit, menyeberangi pelangi, menari sepanjang malam bersama cangkir teh dan teko yang tak akan pernah habis walau dituangkan terus.
Italian (IT): Svolazzavano nel cielo, attraversavano arcobaleni, e danzavano per tutta la notte con una teiera magica che non si sarebbe mai svuotata, insieme a delle tazzine da tè.
Turkish (TR): Gökyüzünde dans eder, gökkuşağının üzerinden geçer, ne kadar doldurursanız doldurun asla boşalmayan büyülü çay fincanları ve çaydanlıklarla bütün gece dans ederlerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): With a flourish of their wands, the stars in the sky would become candy and pour down, and flowers that produced sweets would bud by the roadside.
Steam (ST): With a flourish of her staff, the stars in the sky would become candy and pour down, and flowers that produced sweets would bud by the roadside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With a flourish of her staff, the stars in the sky would become candy and pour down, and flowers that produced sweets would bud by the roadside.
PC Japanese (JP): 杖を振るえば、空の星は飴玉となって降り注ぎ、道端にはお菓子を実らせる花々が芽吹いていた。
Russian (RU): Взмах волшебной палочки, и звёзды в небе превращаются в конфеты и осыпаются вниз, а цветы расцветают сладостями вдоль дороги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com um elegante brandir de suas varinhas, as estrelas no céu transformariam‐se em uma chuva de balas e, na beira da estrada, floresceriam flores capazes de fazer com que doces brotassem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只要揮一下魔杖，天上的星星就會化為糖球落下，路邊有花卉已經發芽，結出的果實是各式的甜點。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只要挥一下魔杖，天上的星星就会化为糖球落下，路边有花卉已经发芽，结出的果实是各式的甜点。
Indonesian (IDN): Dengan sekali ayunan tongkatnya, bintang-bintang di langit akan menjadi permen dan berjatuhan, dan bunga-bunga yang mengeluarkan manisan akan tumbuh di pinggir jalan.
Italian (IT): Agitando la loro bacchetta, le stelle sarebbero diventate caramelle e sarebbero piovute a catinelle, e ai lati delle strade sarebbero sbocciati fiori che avrebbero dato vita a dei dolci...
Turkish (TR): Asalarını bir kez salladıklarında gökyüzündeki yıldızlar şekere dönüşüp yere dökülüyor, ve yol kenarlarında şeker çıkaran çiçekler tomurcuklanıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......To Maria, witches were the sole thing that could give form to the magical dreams that so captivated her.
Steam (ST): ......To Maria, witches were the only concept that could embody the magical dream that so captivated her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......To Maria, a witch was a unique concept, an embodiment of the magical dream that so captivated her.
PC Japanese (JP): ……真里亞にとって魔女は、彼女を虜にする魔法の夢を具現化できる唯一の存在。
Russian (RU): ......Для Марии образ ведьмы был единственным способом воплотить в форму её волшебные мечты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Para Maria, bruxas eram a única coisa que podia dar forma a todos os sonhos que tanto a cativava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對真里亞來說，魔女是能把俘虜著她的魔法之夢具現化的唯一存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对真里亚来说，魔女是能把俘虏着她的魔法之梦具现化的唯一存在。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Bagi Maria, penyihir adalah satu-satunya konsep yang bisa mewakili mimpi ajaib yang begitu mempesonanya.
Italian (IT): Per Maria, le streghe erano le uniche creature che potessero incarnare il sogno della magia che l'aveva tanto ammaliata.
Turkish (TR): ......Maria'ya göre cadılar, onu büyüleyen büyülü hayallere şekil alabilecek tek şeydi.

Umineko Project (UP): The last thing enriching her reality, which revealed more and more of its bland nature to her with every inch she grew.
Steam (ST): As she grew older, it was the last remaining thing that could give richness to her dull and plain everyday life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As she grew up, this was the last thing that gave richness to her dull and plain everyday life.
PC Japanese (JP): 成長すればするほどに知る、無味簡素な現実に潤いを持たせてくれる最後の存在。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 成長すればするほどに知る、無味乾燥な現実に潤いを持たせてくれる最後の存在。
Russian (RU): С возрастом этот образ остался единственным, что обогащало её скучную повседневную жизнь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A última coisa que enriquecia a sua realidade, que revelava cada vez mais a sua suave natureza a cada centímetro que crescia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也是充實著她那“隨著年齡的增長而逐漸意識到的，現實生活的枯燥無味”的最後存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也是充实着她那“随着年龄的增长而逐渐意识到的，现实生活的枯燥无味”的最后存在。
Indonesian (IDN): Seiring bertambahnya usia, itu adalah satu-satunya hal yang masih bisa memberikan warna pada kehidupan sehari-harinya yang datar dan membosankan.
Italian (IT): Erano le ultime cose che arricchivano la blanda e noiosa realtà che aveva conosciuto man mano che era cresciuta.
Turkish (TR): Büyüdüğü her santimde ona tatsız doğasını daha fazla gösteren gerçekliğini zenginleştiren son şey.

Umineko Project (UP): That was why Maria believed in witches.
Steam (ST): That's why Maria believed in witches.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That is why Maria believed in witches.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこそ、真里亞は魔女を信じた。
Russian (RU): Поэтому Мария верила в ведьм.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso que a Maria acreditava em bruxas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，真里亞相信魔女。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，真里亚相信魔女。
Indonesian (IDN): Itulah mengapa Maria percaya pada penyihir.
Italian (IT): Proprio per questo Maria credeva nelle streghe.
Turkish (TR): Maria bu yüzden cadılara inanıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): She didn't want that dream to be insulted.{n}And for that very reason, nor did she want the epitaph, which affirmed the existence of witches, to be insulted.
Steam (ST): She didn't want that dream of hers to be tarnished. That's why she didn't want anyone to tarnish the epitaph,
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She didn't want that dream to be insulted. And, she didn't want the epitaph,
PC Japanese (JP): それを穢されたくなかった。だからこそ、魔女の存在を肯定する碑文も、穢されたくなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それを穢されたくなかった。{n}だからこそ、魔女の存在を肯定する碑文も、穢されたくなかった。
Russian (RU): Она не хотела, чтобы эту мечту оскорбляли.{n}Это и послужило причиной, по которой она не хотела, чтобы эпитафию, которая доказывала существование ведьм, оскорбляли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não queria ver o seu sonho sendo insultado.{n}E por isso, ela não queria que o epitáfio, que afirmava a existência das bruxas, fosse insultado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她不想讓她被玷污。{n}也正因如此，不想讓肯定魔女存在的碑文被玷污。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她不想让她被玷污。{n}也正因如此，不想让肯定魔女存在的碑文被玷污。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia tidak ingin mimpinya ternoda. Itulah mengapa dia tidak ingin siapa pun menodai epitaf itu,
Italian (IT): Non voleva che venissero denigrate. Proprio per questo non voleva che venisse denigrata anche l'epigrafe, la quale confermava l'esistenza della strega.
Turkish (TR): Bu rüyaya saygısızlık edilmesini istemiyordu.{n}Ve tam da bu nedenle, cadıların varlığını onaylayan kitabenin da aşağılanmasını istemiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Because the witch {f:5:Beatrice} {i:is} Maria's dream...
Steam (ST): which affirmed the existence of witches.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): which affirmed the existence of the witch, to be insulted.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女ベアトリーチェは、真里亞の夢そのものだから…。
Russian (RU): Поскольку ведьма {f:5:Беатриче} {i:являлась} мечтой Марии...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque a bruxa {f:5:Beatrice} {i:é} o sonho da Maria...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為魔女貝阿朵莉切，就是真里亞的夢本身…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为魔女贝阿朵莉切，就是真里亚的梦本身…。
Indonesian (IDN): yang mengafirmasi keberadaan penyihir.
Italian (IT): Perché la strega {f:5:Beatrice} {i:era} la personificazione del sogno di Maria...
Turkish (TR): Cadı {f:5:Beatrice} Maria'nın {i:rüyası} olduğu için...

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "To Maria‐chan, this is not something that points to the hiding place of the gold, but magic to revive the witch."
Steam (ST): Because the witch named {f:5:Beatrice} is Maria's dream... "To Maria-chan, the epitaph isn't a guide to the hidden gold,
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because the witch Beatrice is Maria's dream..."To Maria-chan, this is not something that points to the hiding place of the gold,
PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞ちゃんにとっては、これは黄金の隠し場所を示すものじゃなくて、魔女を蘇らせるための、魔法なんだって。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「真里亞ちゃんにとっては、これは黄金の隠し場所を示すものじゃなくて、魔女を蘇らせるための、魔法なんだって」
Russian (RU): "Для Марии‐чан она представляет собой не карту сокровищ, а магию для возрождения ведьмы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Para a Maria‐chan, isso não é algo que indica a localização do ouro, mas uma magia para reviver a bruxa."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對小真里亞來說，這不是表示黃金藏在哪的碑文，而是讓魔女復甦的魔法啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对小真里亚来说，这不是表示黄金藏在哪的碑文，而是让魔女复苏的魔法啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): Karena penyihir bernama {f:5:Beatrice} adalah mimpi milik Maria... "Bagi Maria-chan, epitaf itu bukanlah petunjuk menuju emas tersembunyi,
Italian (IT): "Per Maria-chan, l'epigrafe non è un'indicazione per il nascondiglio dell'oro,{n}ma una magia per resuscitare la strega."
Turkish (TR): "Maria-chan için bu, altının saklandığı yeri gösteren bir şey olmaktan çok, cadıyı diriltmek için olan bir büyü."

Umineko Project (UP): So, it was the single bridge...between Maria and the witch.
Steam (ST): but magic to revive the witch." So it was the single link between Maria and the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): but magic to revive the witch."So it was the single link between Maria and the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、魔女と真里亞を結ぶ、唯一の架け橋。
Russian (RU): Так что это был единственный мостик... между Марией и ведьмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa era a única ponte...entre a Maria e a bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，這是連結著魔女和真里亞的，唯一的橋樑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，这是连结着魔女和真里亚的，唯一的桥梁。
Indonesian (IDN): melainkan sihir untuk membangkitkan kembali sang penyihir." Jadi itu adalah satu-satunya ikatan antara Maria dan penyihir.
Italian (IT): In altre parole, era l'unico ponte... che univa Maria con la strega.
Turkish (TR): Yani, Madia ve cadı arasındaki...tek köprü.

Umineko Project (UP): Maria was very angry and clung onto George‐aniki.
Steam (ST): Maria was very angry and clung to George-aniki.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria was very angry and clung onto George-aniki.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞はすっかりヘソを曲げてしまって、譲治の兄貴に抱きついていた。
Russian (RU): Крайне рассерженная Мария прицепилась к Джорджу‐аники.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria estava muito brava e se agarrou no George‐aniki.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞徹底鬧起了別扭，摟住了讓治大哥。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚彻底闹起了别扭，搂住了让治大哥。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria sangat marah dan memeluk George-aniki erat-erat.
Italian (IT): Maria era molto imbronciata, e si stava aggrappando al fratellone George.
Turkish (TR): Maria çok sinirliydi ve George-aniki'ye sarıldı.

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica and I scratched our heads and apologized.
Steam (ST): Jessica and I scratched our heads and apologized.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica and I scratched our heads and apologized.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺と朱志香は頭を掻きながら謝る。
Russian (RU): Почесав головы, мы с Джессикой извинились перед ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Jessica e eu, passando a mão em nossas cabeças, nos desculpamos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我和朱志香一邊撓著頭一邊道歉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我和朱志香一边挠着头一边道歉。
Indonesian (IDN): Jessica dan aku menggaruk kepala kami dan meminta maaf.
Italian (IT): Io e Jessica chiedemmo scusa grattandoci il capo...
Turkish (TR): Jessica ve ben kafamızı kaşıdık ve özür diledik.

Umineko Project (UP): ...It might not be possible to smooth things over again like the time she got mad in front of the portrait.
Steam (ST): ...It might not be possible to smooth things over again like the time she got mad in front of the portrait.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …さっき肖像画の前でヘソを曲げられた時はすんなり機嫌を直してくれたが、二度目はダメなのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ...Похоже, на этот раз сгладить эту промашку будет не так легко, как в тот раз, когда она рассердилась перед портретом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Pode não ser possível acalmar as coisas de novo assim como na hora em que ela ficou brava diante do retrato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖然剛才在肖像畫前鬧別扭的時候順利地把她哄開心了，但第二次看來是沒那麼容易了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然刚才在肖像画前闹别扭的时候顺利地把她哄开心了，但第二次看来是没那么容易了吧。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Mungkin kali ini tidak akan semudah menenangkan Maria seperti saat dia marah di depan lukisan.
Italian (IT): Quando si era imbronciata di fronte al ritratto eravamo riusciti senza problemi a riportarla di buon umore, ma forse non ce l'avremmo fatta una seconda volta.
Turkish (TR): ...Portrenin önünde sinirlendiği zamanki gibi işleri tekrar yoluna koymak mümkün olmayabilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): Maria didn't want to be easily consoled.{n}As Jessica and I hung our heads, wondering what we could do, Shannon‐chan timidly opened her mouth in our place.
Steam (ST): Maria didn't seem willing to be easily consoled. Unlike Jessica and I, who hung our heads wondering what to do, Shannon-chan timidly opened her mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria didn't want to be easily consoled. Unlike Jessica and I, who hung our heads wondering what we had done, Shannon-chan timidly opened her mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞はもう、簡単に機嫌を直そうとはしてくれなかった。どうしたものか俯く俺と朱志香に変わり、紗音ちゃんがおずおずと口を開いた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞はもう、簡単に機嫌を直そうとはしてくれなかった。{n}どうしたものか俯く俺と朱志香に変わり、紗音ちゃんがおずおずと口を開いた。
Russian (RU): Сейчас Марию было не так легко утешить.{n}Пока мы с Джессикой повесив головы думали над тем, как исправить ситуацию, Шаннон‐чан робко произнесла:
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Maria não iria ser acalmada tão facilmente.{n}Enquanto eu e a Jessica balançamos nossas cabeças, nos perguntando o que poderíamos fazer, a Shannon‐chan timidamente abriu sua boca para falar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞已經不肯簡單地接受我們道歉了。{n}代替了垂著頭束手無策的我和朱志香，紗音有些提心吊膽地開了口。

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "Doors and windows they were sure they'd shut or locked would be open when they came around to double‐check. Lights they'd definitely turned off would be on, and lights they'd definitely turned on would be off. Things would disappear from where they had been placed, and things would appear when no one had any memory of putting them there."
Steam (ST): "When people do the rounds a second time to check doors, windows and locks that were supposedly closed, they'd find some of them left open. Lights that were supposed to be off were turned on, and lights that were supposed to be on went out. Things left lying around would disappear, and things would appear when no one had any memory of putting them there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "When they did the rounds one last time to check supposedly closed doors, windows and locks, some of those would be open. Lights that were supposed to be off were turned on, and lights that were supposed to be on went out. Things left lying around would disappear, and things would appear when no one had any memory of putting them there.
PC Japanese (JP): 「ちゃんと閉めたはずの窓や扉や鍵が、もう一度見回りに来たら開いていたとか。消したはずの灯りが付いていたり、付けたはずの明かりが消えていたり。置いたはずの物がなくなっていたり、置いた覚えのない物が置かれていたり。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ちゃんと閉めたはずの窓や扉や鍵が、もう一度見回りに来たら開いていたとか。消したはずの灯りが点いていたり、点けたはずの灯りが消えていたり。置いたはずの物がなくなっていたり、置いた覚えのない物が置かれていたり」
Russian (RU): "Двери и окна, которые должны были быть закрыты, оказывались открытыми при повторном обходе слуг. Свет, который должен быть выключен, оказывался включённым, а тот, что они точно включали, гас сам по себе. Вещи исчезали со своих мест, а другие появлялись в местах, куда их никто не клал."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Portas e janelas que eles tinham certeza de que estavam fechadas, estavam abertas quando eles a checavam uma segunda vez. Luzes que definitivamente deveriam estar desligadas estavam ligadas, e luzes que deveriam estar ligadas estavam desligadas. Coisas desapareciam do lugar em que elas deveriam estar, e coisas que ninguém lembrava de onde estavam apareciam."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「本應鎖好了門窗的鎖，再來巡視時卻開著呀。本應已經關了的燈卻亮著，本應是亮著的燈卻熄了呀。本應擺好的東西卻消失了，本應記得沒放過的東西卻擺在那裡呀。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「本应锁好了门窗的锁，再来巡视时却开着呀。本应已经关了的灯却亮着，本应是亮着的灯却熄了呀。本应摆好的东西却消失了，本应记得没放过的东西却摆在那里呀。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Saat melakukan pemeriksaan kedua terhadap pintu dan jendela yang seharusnya sudah dikunci, kadang ditemukan terbuka. Lampu yang seharusnya mati malah menyala, dan lampu yang seharusnya menyala jadi mati. Barang-barang yang sebelumnya ada bisa tiba-tiba hilang, dan barang-barang muncul di tempat yang tidak ada orang yang ingat menaruhnya.
Italian (IT): "Quando si faceva un'ultima ronda per controllare se le porte, le finestre e le serrature fossero chiuse per bene, alcune di esse erano aperte. Le luci che dovevano essere spente erano accese, e le luci che dovevano essere accese erano spente. Gli oggetti lasciati da una parte sparivano, e ne apparivano altri che nessuno si ricordava di aver lasciato fuori..."
Turkish (TR): "Kapattıklarından ya da kilitlediklerinden emin oldukları kapılar ve pencereler, tekrar kontrol etmek için geldiklerinde açık olurdu. Kesinlikle kapattıkları ışıklar açık olurdu, ve kesinlikle açtıkları ışıklar sönerdi. Eşyalar yerleştirildikleri yerden kaybolurdu, ve hiç kimsenin oraya koyduğunu hatırlamadığı şeyler etrafta beliriyordu."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria estufou seu peito com um "uu‐uu" como se essa fosse a prova definitiva de que as bruxas existiam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞像是在說這就是魔女實際存在的證據一樣，“嗚——嗚——”地挺起胸膛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚像是在说这就是魔女实际存在的证据一样，“呜——呜——”地挺起胸膛。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria membusungkan dadanya dengan “uu-uu-” seolah itu bukti pamungkas keberadaan penyihir.
Italian (IT): Maria gonfiò il petto facendo un ‘uuh, uuh’, come per affermare che questa fosse la prova definitiva dell'esistenza della strega.
Turkish (TR): Maria sanki bu cadının varlığının son kanıtıymış gibi göğsünü "uu-uu" diye kabarttı.

Umineko Project (UP): If I said it out loud, Maria would probably be hurt again, so I didn't, but...
Steam (ST): If I opened my mouth, Maria would probably be hurt again, so I didn't.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I opened my mouth, Maria would probably be hurt again, so I didn't.
PC Japanese (JP): 口に出せばまた真里亞の機嫌を損ねてしまうだろうから、口にはしないが。
Russian (RU): Если бы я раскрыл рот, то только бы вновь задел Марию, поэтому я промолчал, но...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu dissesse isso em voz alta, a Maria provavelmente iria ficar ofendida de novo, por isso não falei, mas...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我要是在這裡插嘴一定又會惹真里亞不高興，還是不說了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我要是在这里插嘴一定又会惹真里亚不高兴，还是不说了。
Indonesian (IDN): Kalau aku buka mulut sekarang, Maria pasti sakit hati lagi, jadi aku diam saja.
Italian (IT): Se avessi detto la mia avrei finito per offendere Maria, perciò non lo feci...
Turkish (TR): Bunu yüksek sesle söyleseydim, Maria muhtemelen yine incinecekti, bu yüzden söylemedim ama...

Umineko Project (UP): ...I mean, you hear that kind of story everywhere.
Steam (ST): ...I mean, you hear this kind of story everywhere.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …まぁ、どこにでもよくあるような話だった。
Russian (RU): ...В смысле, таких историй сотни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Quero dizer, você ouve esse tipo de história em tudo que é lugar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，這種傳聞其實很常見。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，这种传闻其实很常见。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Yah, cerita kayak begini kan ada di mana-mana.
Italian (IT): Però dai, queste storie si trovano dappertutto.
Turkish (TR): ...Yani, demek istediğim, bu tür hikayeleri her yerde duyarsınız.

Umineko Project (UP): Depending on the place, it might be blamed on fairies or something.{n}It's just that, on this island, they call it the witch.
Steam (ST): Depending on the place, they might blame it on a dwarf or an elf. The only difference is that they call it a witch on this island.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Depending on the place, it might be blamed on a dwarf or an elf. It's just that, on this island, they call it the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): 地方によっては、それを小人の仕業だと呼ぶだろうし、妖精の仕業だと呼ぶだろう。この島ではそれが魔女と呼ばれたというだけの話。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 地方によっては、それを妖精の仕業だと呼ぶだろう。{n}この島ではそれが魔女と呼ばれたというだけの話。
Russian (RU): В зависимости от места, в таких вещах можно винить домового или кого угодно.{n}А вот конкретно на этом острове всё списывают на проказы ведьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dependendo do lugar, podem pôr a culpa em fadas ou outras coisas do tipo.{n}Só que, nessa ilha, eles chamam isso de bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在不同的地方，也有把這說成是妖精幹的不是嘛。{n}而在這個島上呢，就把它說成是魔女幹的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在不同的地方，也有把这说成是妖精干的不是嘛。{n}而在这个岛上呢，就把它说成是魔女干的。
Indonesian (IDN): Tergantung tempatnya saja, kadang mereka menyalahkan kurcaci atau peri. Satu-satunya perbedaan adalah di pulau ini disebut penyihir.
Italian (IT): In base alla località, si avrebbe dato la colpa di ciò ad uno gnomo, oppure ad una fata. In quest'isola si diceva semplicemente che è stata una strega.
Turkish (TR): Yerine göre periler ya da başka bir şey suçlanabilir.{n}Sadece bu adada buna cadı diyorlar.

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, you would expect that walking around a vast, elegant mansion at night would be a little unsettling.
Steam (ST): Of course, walking around a vast, elegant mansion at night would be a little unsettling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, you would expect that walking around a vast, elegant mansion at night would be a little unsettling.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かに、風情ある狭くない屋敷の中を夜回りすれば、不気味でないはずはない。
Russian (RU): Естественно, что прогуливаться по величественному особняку глубокой ночью немного страшновато.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, passear por essa grande e elegante mansão durante a noite pode ser um pouco assustador.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 確實，要在這種寬廣又別具一格的大屋裡巡夜，那不可能不覺得陰森。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 确实，要在这种宽广又别具一格的大屋里巡夜，那不可能不觉得阴森。
Indonesian (IDN): Tentu saja, berjalan sendirian di mansion mewah dan luas saat malam bisa cukup menyeramkan.
Italian (IT): Certo, sarebbe un po' inquietante fare il guardiano notturno in un'enorme villa elegante.
Turkish (TR): Elbette, geceleri büyük, zarif bir malikanede dolaşmanın biraz tedirgin edici olmasını beklersiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): It's an island devoid of people. Since the mansion is so drafty, walking around on the night of a thunderstorm would certainly be eerie.
Steam (ST): It's an island devoid of people. Since the mansion is so drafty, walking around on the night of a thunderstorm would certainly be eerie.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's an island devoid of people. Since the mansion is so drafty, walking around on the night of a thunderstorm would certainly be eerie.
PC Japanese (JP): ひと気のない島だ。隙間風の入る屋敷だそうだから、雷雨の夜の見回りはさぞかし薄気味悪いに違いないだろう。
Russian (RU): И на острове людей почти что нет. К тому же по особняку гуляют сквозняки, так что ночью, в грозу, здесь определённо жутко.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É uma ilha desprovida de pessoas. Como essa mansão é muito fria, andar por ela durante uma noite de tempestade se torna algo misterioso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個小島上人跡罕至。再加上這大屋裡似乎能透得進涼風，要是雷雨之夜一個人在這裡巡視，那想必是挺陰森恐怖的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个小岛上人迹罕至。再加上这大屋里似乎能透得进凉风，要是雷雨之夜一个人在这里巡视，那想必是挺阴森恐怖的。
Indonesian (IDN): Pulau ini pun sepi dari manusia. Mansion-nya besar dan berangin, kalau malam hari hujan petir pasti suasananya menyeramkan.
Italian (IT): Era un'isola disabitata. Probabilmente la villa era piena di spifferi, per cui fare la ronda notturna durante un temporale sarebbe di certo un po' spaventoso.
Turkish (TR): Burası insanlardan yoksun bir ada. Malikane çok esintili olduğu için, fırtınalı bir gecede etrafta dolaşmak kesinlikle ürkütücü olurdu.

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "In addition, some servants have also seen will‐o'‐the‐wisps and glittering butterflies dancing around. ......Kanon‐kun also said he saw something like that when he went patrolling one night."
Steam (ST): "In addition, some servants have also seen will-o'-the-wisps and glittering butterflies dancing around. ...Kanon-kun also saw something like that when he went patrolling one night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In addition, some servants have also seen will‐o'‐the‐wisps and glittering butterflies dancing around. Kanon-kun also saw something like that when he went patrolling one night.
PC Japanese (JP): 「他にも、鬼火や輝く蝶々が舞っているのを見たという使用人も。……嘉音くんもそれらしいものを、以前、夜の見回りの時に見たことがあると言ってました。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「他にも、鬼火や輝く蝶々が舞っているのを見たという使用人も。……嘉音くんもそれらしいものを、以前、夜の見回りの時に見たことがあると言ってました」
Russian (RU): "Вдобавок, некоторые слуги также видели блуждающие огоньки и сверкающих бабочек, кружащихся, словно в танце. ......Канон‐кун говорил, что тоже видел нечто подобное во время ночного обхода."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Junto a isso, alguns serviçais dizem ter visto algumas brilhantes borboletas estonteantes dançando. ......O Kanon‐kun também já disse ter visto algo assim quando estava fazendo a ronda durante a noite."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「除此之外，還有傭人見過鬼火和閃耀的蝴蝶飄舞在空中。……嘉音君也說過，以前他在巡夜時見過類似的東西。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「除此之外，还有佣人见过鬼火和闪耀的蝴蝶飘舞在空中。……嘉音君也说过，以前他在巡夜时见过类似的东西。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Selain itu, beberapa pelayan juga pernah melihat api hantu dan kupu-kupu berkilauan menari-nari. ...Kanon-kun juga pernah melihat sesuatu seperti itu saat dia patroli malam.
Italian (IT): "Inoltre, altri domestici hanno visto danzare dei fuochi fatui e delle farfalle luccicanti. Anche Kanon-kun disse di aver visto qualcosa di simile durante il suo turno di guardia notturno."
Turkish (TR): "Buna ek olarak, bazı hizmetkârlar etrafta dans eden hayaletler ve ışıltılı kelebekler de görmüşlerdir. ......Kanon-kun da bir gece vardiyasına çıktığında böyle bir şey gördüğünü söyledi."

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "And recently, the servants have been talking about strange footsteps inside the mansion near midnight. We have whispered together that {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama from the portrait sometimes makes herself invisible and walks through the mansion."
Steam (ST): And recently, you often hear servants talking about strange footsteps heard inside the mansion near midnight. We've whispered together that the {f:5:Beatrice}-sama in the portrait sometimes makes herself invisible and walks through the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And recently, the servants have been talking about strange footsteps inside the mansion near midnight. We have whispered together that the Beatrice-sama from the portrait sometimes makes herself invisible and walks through the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): あと、最近ではお屋敷の中で深夜に、不思議な足音をよく聞くと使用人の間で話題です。私たちは、肖像画の中のベアトリーチェさまが姿を消してお屋敷の中を散歩しているんだろうと囁き合ってるんですよ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あと、最近ではお屋敷の中で深夜に、不思議な足音をよく聞くと使用人の間で話題です。私たちは、肖像画の中のベアトリーチェさまが姿を消してお屋敷の中を散歩しているんだろうと囁き合ってるんですよ」
Russian (RU): "А недавно слуги стали поговаривать о разносящихся по особняку звуках шагов ближе к полуночи. Мы перешёптывались, что {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама, изображённая на портрете, иногда становится невидимой и гуляет по особняку."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E recentemente, os serviçais têm falado sobre ouvir estranhos passos dentro da mansão durante a noite. Nós comentamos que a {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama fica invisível e anda pela mansão."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「還有，這話最近在傭人之間傳得很火，說最近深夜大屋中經常可以聽到神秘的腳步聲。我們私下裡都在說，這可能是肖像畫中的貝阿朵莉切夫人隱去身形在大屋中散步呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「还有，这话最近在佣人之间传得很火，说最近深夜大屋中经常可以听到神秘的脚步声。我们私下里都在说，这可能是肖像画中的贝阿朵莉切夫人隐去身形在大屋中散步呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): Dan akhir-akhir ini, para pelayan sering bicara tentang suara langkah kaki aneh yang terdengar di dalam mansion sekitar tengah malam. Kami berbisik bahwa {f:5:Beatrice}-sama dari potret itu kadang membuat dirinya tak terlihat dan berjalan keliling mansion.
Italian (IT): "E poi, ultimamente tra i domestici si dice che a notte fonda spesso si sentono degli strani passi all'interno della villa. Tra di noi gira voce che la {f:5:Beatrice} del ritratto svanisca, per poi camminare lungo la villa..."
Turkish (TR): "Ve son zamanlarda, hizmetkârlar gece yarısına doğru malikanenin içinde duydukları garip ayak seslerinden bahsediyorlardı. Portredeki {f:5:Beatrice}-sama'nın bazen kendini görünmez kıldığını ve malikanenin içinde gezdiğininden aramızda bahsederdik."

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "...It happened a long time ago, but I have also heard those kinds of footsteps while patrolling at night."
Steam (ST): ...It happened a while ago, but even I have heard footsteps while patrolling at night that resemble these stories."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It happened a long time ago, but I have also heard those kinds of footsteps while patrolling at night."
PC Japanese (JP): …ずいぶん前ですが、私もそうかもしれない足音を、夜の見回りの時に聞いたことがあります。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…ずいぶん前ですが、私もそうかもしれない足音を、夜の見回りの時に聞いたことがあります」
Russian (RU): "...Это произошло давно, но я тоже слышала эти шаги, совершая ночной обход."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Isso aconteceu há muito tempo atrás, mas eu também ouvi alguns passos enquanto fazia a ronda durante a noite."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…雖然是很久以前的事了，但我也在巡夜時，聽到過類似的腳步聲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…虽然是很久以前的事了，但我也在巡夜时，听到过类似的脚步声。」
Indonesian (IDN): ...Itu terjadi beberapa waktu lalu, tapi aku sendiri juga pernah mendengar langkah kaki saat patroli malam yang mirip dengan cerita ini."
Italian (IT): "Mi successe molto tempo fa, ma anche io ho sentito dei rumori di passi simili durante le mie ronde notturne."
Turkish (TR): "...Bu uzun zaman önce oldu, ama bu tür ayak seslerini geceleri devriye gezerken ben de duydum."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......Whew. That's scary..."
Steam (ST): "......Whew. That's scary..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ひゅう。そりゃ怖ぇな…。」
Russian (RU): "......Ого. Жуть какая..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Fiuu. Que assustador..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……咻——。這可挺恐怖的啊…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……咻——。这可挺恐怖的啊…」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Whew. Seram juga ya..."
Italian (IT): "...Fiuuu. Da paura..."
Turkish (TR): "......Whew. Bu korkutucu..."

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "Ah, ...but, there's nothing to be afraid of, you know? {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama is another ruler of this mansion separate from the Master. So, she won't do anything bad, as long as you respect her and don't act oddly afraid."
Steam (ST): "Ah, ...but there's nothing to be afraid of. {f:5:Beatrice}-sama is another ruler of this mansion, separate from the Master. So, there's no need to be unnaturally afraid. If you respect her, I hear she won't do anything bad."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Ah, ...but, there's nothing to be afraid of, right? Beatrice-sama is another ruler of this mansion separate from the Master. Therefore, don't be strangely afraid. If you respect her, she won't do anything bad."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あ、…でも、怯えることはないんですよ？　ベアトリーチェさまはお館様とは異なる、もう一人のお屋敷の主です。だから変に怯えたりしないで、敬意を持っていれば、決して悪いことはしないのだそうです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あ、…でも、怯えることはないんですよ？　ベアトリーチェさまはお館様とは異なる、もう一人のお屋敷の主です。だから変に怯えたりしないで、敬意を持っていれば、決して悪いことはしないのだそうです」
Russian (RU): "Ах... но, вы знаете... вам нечего бояться. {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама является ещё одним хозяином поместья. Поэтому она не сделает ничего плохого, пока вы будете почитать её, не выказывая беспричинный страх."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah, ...mas, não há nada para se temer, sabia? A {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama é a outra governante dessa mansão, além do Mestre. Por isso, ela não faz nada de ruim, contanto que você a respeite e não aja como se tivesse medo dela."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊…不過，沒什麼好害怕的哦？貝阿朵莉切夫人是與老爺不同的另一位大屋主人。所以不要無端害怕，據說只要抱有敬意的話，她是絕對不會害你的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊…不过，没什么好害怕的哦？贝阿朵莉切夫人是与老爷不同的另一位大屋主人。所以不要无端害怕，据说只要抱有敬意的话，她是绝对不会害你的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Ah, ...tapi tidak ada yang perlu ditakuti. {f:5:Beatrice}-sama adalah penguasa lain dari mansion ini, terpisah dari Tuan besar. Jadi, tidak perlu takut secara berlebihan. Kalau anda menghormatinya, katanya dia tidak akan melakukan hal buruk."
Italian (IT): "Ah, ma... non c'è niente di cui aver paura, va bene? {f:5:Beatrice}-sama è un'altra sovrana di questa villa, diversa dalla figura del padrone. Perciò, non bisogna necessariamente temerla. Ho sentito che finché la si rispetta, non farà nulla di male."
Turkish (TR): "Ah, ...ama, korkacak hiçbir şey yok. {f:5:Beatrice}-sama sadece bu malikanenin Efendiden ayrı diğer bir yöneticisi. Yani, ona saygı duyduğunuz ve garip bir şekilde korkmuş gibi davranmadığınız sürece kötü bir şey yapmayacaktır."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "However, she's fearsome if you don't respect her, right?"
Steam (ST): "However, she can be quite terrifying if you don't respect her, right?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "However, it would be dreadful if you didn't respect her, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ただし、敬意を持たないと恐ろしいんだったね？」
Russian (RU): "Однако если не проявить должного уважения, она не будет столь благосклонна, так?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No entanto, ela pode ser assustadora se você não respeitá‐la, certo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可是，如果沒有敬意的話就會很可怕吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可是，如果没有敬意的话就会很可怕吧？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Namun, dia bisa sangat menyeramkan kalau kamu tidak menghormatinya, kan?"
Italian (IT): "Ma è spaventosa se le si manca di rispetto, giusto?"
Turkish (TR): "Ancak, ona saygı duymazsanız korkutucu olur, değil mi?"

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "...Yes. I heard that someone who quit just before I began working, after falling down the stairs and receiving a large injury to their back, had been speaking badly of {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Because of that, there was a rumor between the servants that {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama's anger had been brought down upon this person..."
Steam (ST): "...Correct. I've heard that, just before I began working here, someone who spoke badly about {f:5:Beatrice}-sama fell down the stairs and quit after receiving a large injury to their back. Because of that, there was a rumor between the servants that {f:5:Beatrice}-sama's anger had been brought down upon this person..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Yes. I heard that, just before I began working, someone who spoke badly about Beatrice-sama fell down the stairs and quit after receiving a large injury to their back. Because of that, there was a rumor between the servants that Beatrice-sama's anger had been brought down upon this person..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…はい。私が勤めを始める直前に、階段を転がり落ちて腰に大怪我をして辞めた方は、ベアトリーチェさまのことを悪く言っていたそうです。だから使用人たちは、ベアトリーチェさまのお怒りに触れたのだろうと噂しあったそうです…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…はい。私が勤めを始める直前に、階段を転がり落ちて腰に大怪我をして辞めた方は、ベアトリーチェさまのことを悪く言っていたそうです。だから使用人たちは、ベアトリーチェさまのお怒りに触れたのだろうと噂しあったそうです…」
Russian (RU): "...Да. Я слышала, что перед моим приходом на работу, кое‐кто упал с лестницы и сильно повредил спину, после чего уволился, и он как раз плохо отзывался о {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама. Из‐за этого среди слуг распространился слух, что тот человек испытал на себе гнев {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim. Eu ouvi que teve uma pessoa que pediu demissão logo depois de ter começado a trabalhar aqui após cair da escada e sofrer várias lesões nas costas, tinha falado mal da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. Por causa disso, tem um rumor entre os serviçais de que a fúria da {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama havia caído sobre essa pessoa..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…是的。聽說在我快來這裡工作之前，從樓梯上滾下來導致腰部受重傷而辭職的那位，好像就說過貝阿朵莉切夫人的壞話。所以傭人們都在傳，說他應該是觸怒了貝阿朵莉切夫人…」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente, ela havia terminado sua pesquisa; e vigorosamente fechou o caderno em um piscar de olhos, jogando‐o em sua bolsa, e começou a procurar algo dentro dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大概終於研究完了吧，她啪的一聲猛然把筆記本合上放進手提包裡，開始在手提包中找了起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大概终于研究完了吧，她啪的一声猛然把笔记本合上放进手提包里，开始在手提包中找了起来。
Indonesian (IDN): Ketika Maria akhirnya menemukan apa yang dia cari, dia menutup buku catatannya dan memasukkannya ke dalam tas. Lalu dia mulai mengobrak-abrik isi tas tersebut.
Italian (IT): Alla fine, dopo che Maria terminò la sua ricerca, sbattè di colpo il diario e lo gettò nella sua borsetta, per poi iniziare a rovistarne il contenuto.
Turkish (TR): Belki de araştırmasını bitirmişti; defteri bir çırpıda kapatıp çantasına attı ve içindekileri karıştırmaya başladı.

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that various jumbled up things were in there.
Steam (ST): There seemed to be various jumbled up things in there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that various jumbled up things were in there.
PC Japanese (JP): どうもごちゃごちゃと色々なものがしまわれているようだった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, там всё хранилось вперемешку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que haviam várias coisas misturadas dentro dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看來裡面亂七八糟地放了不少東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看来里面乱七八糟地放了不少东西。
Indonesian (IDN): Tampaknya ada berbagai macam benda campur aduk di sana.
Italian (IT): Sembrava che ci fossero molte cose gettate alla rinfusa lì dentro.
Turkish (TR): İçinde karmakarışık bir sürü şey varmış gibi görünüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): For a while, she continued to take out various pieces of junk—although they were probably important magical items to her—and repeatedly throw them back in, saying they were wrong.
Steam (ST): After a while, she took out various pieces of junk—although they were probably important magical items to Maria— and repeatedly threw them back in, saying they were wrong.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After a while, she took out various pieces of junk - although they were probably important magical items to Maria - and repeatedly threw them back in, saying they were wrong.
PC Japanese (JP): しばらくの間、様々なガラクタ（真里亞にとっては重要なマジックアイテムなんだろう）を取り出しては、これは違う、あれは違うと出し入れを繰り返した。
Russian (RU): Какое‐то время она продолжала вытаскивать различное барахло (хотя для неё все эти вещи, скорее всего, являлись магическими артефактами), и бросала обратно, приговаривая, что это не то.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por um tempo, ela continuou a tirar vários pedaços de lixo — apesar de provavelmente serem importantes itens mágicos para ela — e repetidamente jogando‐os de volta, dizendo que eram os errados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一時間，她取出了各種各樣的破爛（對真里亞來說應該是重要的魔法道具），說著“這不對，這也不對”地放進放出。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一时间，她取出了各种各样的破烂（对真里亚来说应该是重要的魔法道具），说着“这不对，这也不对”地放进放出。
Indonesian (IDN): Setelah beberapa saat, dia mengeluarkan berbagai barang aneh—meski mungkin itu benda penting bagi Maria— dan berulang kali memasukkannya kembali sambil bilang itu bukan yang dia cari.
Italian (IT): Dopo un po', tirò fuori numerose cianfrusaglie (probabilmente per Maria erano degli oggetti magici preziosi) per poi rimetterle a posto, dicendo che per un motivo o per un altro non andassero bene.
Turkish (TR): Bir süre çeşitli ıvır zıvır parçaları çıkarmaya devam etti—her ne kadar muhtemelen onun için önemli büyülü eşyalar olsalar da—ve yanlış olduklarını söyleyerek tekrar tekrar geri çantasına atıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): She looked a little humorous, almost like Santa Claus deliberating over which present to give.
Steam (ST): It was all a little humorous, just like when Doraemon took out the wrong tool.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was all a little humorous, just like when Dora○mon took out the wrong tool.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、取り出す道具を間違えたドラ○もんみたいでちょっぴりユーモラスだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): まるで、プレゼントをあれでもない、これでもないと選んでは悩んでいるサンタクロースみたいでちょっぴりユーモラスだ。
Russian (RU): Она выглядела слегка забавно, почти как Дед Мороз, который достаёт не те подарки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi um pouco cômico, quase como o Papai Noel, ponderando sobre qual presente iria dar; fazendo expressões engraçadas, igual ao Doraemon quando pega um item errado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就跟苦惱著不知要送什麼禮物好的聖誕老人一樣，看起來有點滑稽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就跟苦恼着不知要送什么礼物好的圣诞老人一样，看起来有点滑稽。
Indonesian (IDN): Semua itu agak lucu, seperti saat Doraemon mengeluarkan alat yang salah.
Italian (IT): Era piuttosto divertente, proprio come quando Dora*mon tirava fuori il ciusky sbagliato.
Turkish (TR): Biraz komik görünüyordu, neredeyse hangi hediyeyi vereceğini düşünen Noel Baba gibiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Finally, it seemed that she had excavated what she was looking for.
Steam (ST): Finally, she seemed to discover what she was looking for.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Finally, it seemed that she had discovered what she was looking for.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、お目当てのものをようやく発掘できたらしい。
Russian (RU): Наконец, она, по‐видимому, нашла то, что искала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Finalmente, parece que ela havia escavado aquilo que estava procurando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 終於，她好像發現了要找的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 终于，她好像发现了要找的东西。
Indonesian (IDN): Akhirnya, dia tampak menemukan apa yang dia cari.
Italian (IT): Alla fine, sembrava che avesse trovato ciò che stava cercando.
Turkish (TR): Sonunda, aradığı şeyi bulmuş gibi görünüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): With a face unimaginably brighter than the difficult expression she had worn until now, she stuck "them" out to Jessica and me.
Steam (ST): With a face that was unimaginably cheery when compared to the intense expression she had worn until now, she held "those" out to Jessica and me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With a face unimaginably clearer than the difficult expression she had worn until now, she stuck 'them' out to Jessica and me.
PC Japanese (JP): さっきまでのむずかった表情からは想像もつかないくらいに晴れ晴れしい顔で、ソレを俺と朱志香に突き出した。
Russian (RU): С просветлевшим лицом она извлекла "их", чтобы продемонстрировать мне и Джессике.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com uma expressão inimaginavelmente mais alegre do que ela havia demonstrado até agora, ela mostrou "aquilo" para mim e para a Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞把那玩意向我和朱志香遞了過來，露著一副開朗的表情——開朗得根本沒法從剛才的一臉苦相中聯想到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚把那玩意向我和朱志香递了过来，露着一副开朗的表情——开朗得根本没法从刚才的一脸苦相中联想到。
Indonesian (IDN): Dengan wajah yang jauh lebih ceria dibanding ekspresi seriusnya barusan, dia mengulurkan "benda itu" kepada Jessica dan aku.
Italian (IT): Porse ‘qualcosa’ a me e a Jessica, con una faccia così raggiante che, in confronto all'espressione imbronciata che aveva finora, aveva quasi dell'incredibile.
Turkish (TR): Şimdiye kadar takındığı katı ifadeden hayal edilemeyecek kadar parlak bir yüz ifadesiyle, Jessica ve bana "onları" uzattı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー！」
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Indonesian (IDN): [=ST]
Italian (IT): "Uuh!"
Turkish (TR): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): As I reached out to grab it, I noticed that it was a very cheap‐looking charm.
Steam (ST): I grabbed it...and saw that it was a very cheap-looking charm.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As I reached out to grab it, I noticed that it was a very cheap-looking charm.
PC Japanese (JP): 受け取ってみると、それはいかにも安っぽそうなおまじないアイテムだった。
Russian (RU): Когда я протянул руку, чтобы взять этот предмет, я обнаружил дешёвый талисман.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que estendi a mão para pegá‐lo, percebi que era um amuleto de aparência muito barata.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接過來一看，那是個怎麼看都是便宜貨的符咒道具。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接过来一看，那是个怎么看都是便宜货的符咒道具。
Indonesian (IDN): Aku mengambilnya... dan melihat bahwa itu adalah jimat yang terlihat sangat murah.
Italian (IT): Lo afferrai, e notai che era un portafortuna dall'aspetto abbastanza scadente.
Turkish (TR): Onu almak için uzandığımda, çok ucuz görünümlü bir tılsım olduğunu fark ettim.

Umineko Project (UP): It looked like a bracelet made from a plastic rosary, with a scorpion‐motif medal attached.
Steam (ST): It looked like a bracelet made from a plastic rosary, ...with a scorpion-themed medal attached.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked like a bracelet made from a plastic rosary, with a scorpion motif medal attached.
PC Japanese (JP): プラスチック製の軽い数珠で作ったブレスレット風のもので、サソリをモチーフにしたようなデザインのメダルが付いていた。
Russian (RU): Он выглядел как браслет, сделанный из пластмассовых чёток, с прилепленным к нему медальоном, изображающим скорпиона.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia um bracelete feito com um rosário de plástico, com uma medalha de escorpião presa nela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 有點像是個用輕質的塑料念珠串成的手鐲，還連著一塊刻有蠍子圖案的紀念章。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 有点像是个用轻质的塑料念珠串成的手镯，还连着一块刻有蝎子图案的纪念章。
Indonesian (IDN): Bentuknya seperti gelang dari rosario plastik, ...dengan medali bergambar kalajengking.
Italian (IT): Era una specie di braccialetto fatto con perline cave di plastica, a cui vi era attaccato una medaglietta che ritraeva l'immagine di uno scorpione.
Turkish (TR): Plastik tespihlerden yapılmış bir bileziğe benziyordu, ve üzerinde akrep motifli bir madalya vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): I mean, you often find cheap accessories that correspond to the constellations.
Steam (ST): Haven't you ever seen those cheap, zodiac-themed accessories?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I mean, you often find cheap accessories that correspond to the constellations.
PC Japanese (JP): ほら、よく１２星座に対応した安っぽいアクセサリーがあったりするじゃないか。
Russian (RU): Подобные дешёвые украшения со знаком зодиака попадаются довольно часто.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quero dizer, você encontra muitas vezes esse tipo de acessório barato correspondente a constelações.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不是常有那種對應十二星座的便宜貨小飾品嘛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不是常有那种对应十二星座的便宜货小饰品嘛。
Indonesian (IDN): Pernah lihat aksesori murah bertema zodiak seperti itu?
Italian (IT): Ecco, avete presente quegli accessori a basso prezzo a tema zodiacale?
Turkish (TR): Takımyıldızlara karşılık gelen ucuz aksesuarları sık sık bulabilirsiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): It felt like a gift that you might win in the crane game at an arcade. It really looked like something like that.
Steam (ST): The kind you might win in a crane game at an arcade. It really looked like something like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It felt like a gift that you might win in the crane game at an arcade. It really looked like something like that.
PC Japanese (JP): ゲームセンターのクレーンゲームの景品にでもありそうな感じの。まさにそんなものに見えた。
Russian (RU): Пожалуй, такую безделушку можно было выиграть в игровом автомате с краном. По крайней мере, именно так он и выглядел.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia um presente que você poderia ganhar em um fliperama. Parecia realmente algo desse tipo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 感覺在游戲廳的抓娃娃機裡也能找到類似的獎品。越看越像那種東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 感觉在游戏厅的抓娃娃机里也能找到类似的奖品。越看越像那种东西。
Indonesian (IDN): Yang biasanya kau dapat dari mesin capit di arcade. Benda ini benar-benar seperti itu.
Italian (IT): Sembrava quel genere di premio che si può vincere alle macchinette con la gru nelle sale giochi. Era praticamente identico.
Turkish (TR): Bu, tıpkı atari salonundaki vinç oyununda kazanabileceğiniz bir hediye gibi geldi. Gerçekten de öyle bir şeye benziyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): There were two. Probably one for me and one for Jessica.
Steam (ST): There were two of them. Probably one for me and one for Jessica.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were two. Probably one for me and one for Jessica.
PC Japanese (JP): それが２つ。俺と朱志香の分という意味だろう。
Russian (RU): Браслетов было два. Наверное, один для меня, а другой — для Джессики.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Haviam dois. Provavelmente um para mim e outro para a Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且有兩個。大概是代表我和朱志香一人一個吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且有两个。大概是代表我和朱志香一人一个吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Ada dua buah. Mungkin satu untukku dan satu untuk Jessica.
Italian (IT): Ne aveva due. Probabilmente uno era per me e uno era per Jessica...
Turkish (TR): İki tane vardı. Muhtemelen biri bana, biri de Jessica'ya.

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, considering the odd fact that there were two of them, they looked like cheap manufactured goods, and it was quite hard to think of them as magical items.
Steam (ST): ...However, the very fact that there were two of them made them feel even more like cheap, manufactured goods, making it pretty hard to think of them as magical items.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、変に２つあるせいで余計、量産品っぽい安っぽさがあり、とてもマジックアイテムとしてのありがたさが感じられない。
Russian (RU): ......Однако невзирая на странный факт, что их было два, они выглядели как дешёвые изделия, из‐за чего их было трудно воспринимать как некий магический талисман.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Porém, considerando o estranho fato de ter dois deles, eles pareciam ser produtos manufaturados bem baratos, e foi bem difícil de pensar neles como itens mágicos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然而，有兩個反而更讓人覺得它是批量生產的不值錢玩意，怎麼都感覺不出魔法道具該有的珍貴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然而，有两个反而更让人觉得它是批量生产的不值钱玩意，怎么都感觉不出魔法道具该有的珍贵。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Namun, kenyataan bahwa ada dua malah makin menegaskan kesan barang massal, dan agak sulit membayangkannya sebagai benda sihir sungguhan.
Italian (IT): Comunque sia, la loro pacchianità da prodotto di fabbrica era dovuta proprio al fatto che ce n'erano due, rendendo piuttosto difficile considerarli come oggetti magici.
Turkish (TR): ......Ancak, iki tane olmaları gibi tuhaf bir gerçek göz önüne alındığında ucuza imal edilmiş mallara benziyorlardı, ve onları büyülü eşyalar olarak düşünmek oldukça zordu.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-! With these charms, even Beatrice is no problem! Because the scorpion has the power to block magic!"

Russian (RU): "У‐у! С этими талисманами вам даже {f:5:Беатриче} не страшна! Потому что скорпион обладает силой блокировать магию!"

Umineko Project (UP): Maria took out her notebook again, and turned and pointed to page after page, going on and on about how the scorpion had holy power, and had been drawn on magic‐repelling magic circles since ancient times.
Steam (ST): Maria took out her notebook again, pointing out various pages as she went on and on about how the scorpion had such incredible holy power that it had been used in magic-repelling magical circles since ancient times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria took out her notebook again, and while pointing out various pages, went on and on about how the scorpion had holy power, and that it had been drawn in magic-repelling magical circles since ancient times.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は再び手帳を取り出すと、様々なページを開いては突きつけ、いかにサソリには神聖な力があって、古来から魔除けの魔法陣に描かれてきたかを延々と説かれることになった。
Russian (RU): Мария опять извлекла свой блокнот и, демонстрируя разные его страницы, пустилась в объяснения о том, что скорпион имеет святую силу, и что его рисовали в отражающих магических кругах с древних времён.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria pegou seu caderno mais uma vez, passando página por página, até chegar onde falava sobre o poder sagrado do escorpião, e que desde os tempos antigos se desenhava círculos mágicos para repelir a magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞又取出筆記本，翻開好幾頁擺在我眼前，不停說著蠍子是如何的具有神聖之力，自古以來都被畫在驅魔的魔法陣裡之類的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚又取出笔记本，翻开好几页摆在我眼前，不停说着蝎子是如何的具有神圣之力，自古以来都被画在驱魔的魔法阵里之类的。
Indonesian (IDN): Maria mengeluarkan buku catatannya lagi, menunjukkan berbagai halaman sambil menjelaskan panjang lebar tentang kekuatan suci kalajengking yang telah digunakan dalam lingkaran sihir pelindung sejak zaman dahulu.
Italian (IT): Maria tirò fuori di nuovo il suo quaderno, e indicando con veemenza svariate pagine, continuava a spiegare come lo scorpione avesse dei poteri soprannaturali, e che era raffigurato in cerchi magici protettivi sin dall'antichità.
Turkish (TR): Maria defterini tekrar çıkardı ve sayfalar boyunca akrebin nasıl kutsal bir güce sahip olduğunu, ve çok eski zamanlardan beri büyüyü engelleyen büyülü çemberlerin üzerine çizildiğini anlatıp durdu.

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "......Ah, I've heard about that from some of the other young servants. Something about how the scorpion is drawn as a magic‐repelling symbol in sorcery..."
Steam (ST): "......Ah, I've heard about that from some of the other young servants. Something about how the scorpion is drawn as a magic-repelling symbol in sorcery..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Ah, I've heard about that from some of the other young servants. Something about how the scorpion is drawn as a magic repelling symbol in sorcery..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あ、他の使用人の子から聞いたことがあります。サソリって、魔術では魔除けのシンボルとして描かれることもあるんだとか…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……あ、他の使用人の子から聞いたことがあります。サソリって、魔術では魔除けのシンボルとして描かれることもあるんだとか…」
Russian (RU): "......Ах, я слышала об этом от одного из других молодых слуг. О том, что скорпиона применяют в колдовстве, как отражающий магию символ..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ah, eu já ouvi outros jovens serviçais falando sobre isso. Algo sobre como o desenho do escorpião é um símbolo que repele a magia na bruxaria..."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……啊，我听别的佣人说过。在魔术中，也会把蝎子画成驱魔的象征…」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Ah, aku pernah dengar dari beberapa pelayan muda. Katanya kalajengking memang sering digambar sebagai simbol penangkal sihir dalam ilmu sihir..."
Italian (IT): "...Ah, me l'avevano detto alcuni degli altri giovani domestici. Qualcosa sul fatto che nella stregoneria lo scorpione è raffigurato come un simbolo che protegge dalla magia..."
Turkish (TR): "......Ah, bunu diğer bazı genç hizmetkârlardan duymuştum. Akrebin büyücülükte büyü bozucu bir sembol olarak nasıl çizildiği hakkında bir şeyler..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu! The scorpion protects against bad magic and disasters. And emerald brings peace to the heart. So it has double the effect! Uu!"
Steam (ST): "Uu-! The scorpion protects against bad magic and calamity. And emerald brings peace to the heart. Therefore, its effects are two-fold! Uu-!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Uu-! The scorpion protects against bad magic and misfortune. And emerald brings peace to the heart. Therefore, the effect is double! Uu-!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー！　サソリは悪い魔法や災厄から守ってくれる。そしてエメラルドは心に平和をもたらしてくれる。だから二重で効果がある！　うー！」
Russian (RU): "У‐у! Скорпион защищает от злой магии и напастей. А изумруд дарит сердцу покой. Поэтому достигается двойной эффект! У‐у!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uu! O escorpião protege contra a magia ruim e desastres. E a esmeralda traz a paz para o coração. Então tem efeito duplo! Uu!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗚——！蠍子可以保護你免受災難和壞魔法。而祖母綠可以使心境平和。所以有雙重效果！嗚——！」

Indonesian (IDN): "Uu-! Kalajengking melindungi dari sihir jahat dan bencana. Dan zamrud membawa kedamaian dalam hati. Jadi, efeknya dua kali lipat! Uu-!"
Italian (IT): "Uuh! Lo scorpione protegge dalla magia cattiva e dai disastri. E lo smeraldo porta pace al cuore. Così l'effetto vale doppio! Uuh!"
